channel.title: [Hiscores] Creating New Runescape Hiscores 2014 [RS3]
channel.description:
I think Moparscape has been needing this for a while, updated and current Runescape 3 Highscores. This is for newer revisions, but works for older revisions (317). [i][b]It would be useful if someone could create tutorials for revisions other than 317, I'm a web guy, not a java guy. [/b][/i]
[center][u][b][size=18pt]Table of Contents[/size][/b][/u] [size=14pt][b]I.[/b] Features [b]II.[/b] Download Packages [b]III.[/b] Tutorials and Instructions [b]IV.[/b] Images [b]V.[/b] Tested Server Revisions, and Bugs. [b]VI.[/b] Credits[/size][/center]
[size=18pt][b]I. Features[/b][/size] Here is a list of all the current features, and features that are coming soon.
[ul][li]Overall rankings[/li] [li]Skill-specific rankings[/li] [li]Player comparison[/li] [li]Player search[/li] [li]15 results per page[/li] [li]Donator icons[/li] [li]Don't display staff[/li] [li]Simple configuration file[/li] [li]'Go to' page box[/li] [li]Player avatars[/li] [li]Clan rankings[/li] [li]Activity rankings[/li] [li]Site/Forum integration[/li][/ul]
[b][size=18pt]II. Download Packages[/size][/b]
[b][size=14pt]Complete Package[/size] [size=12pt][b](Recommended)[/b][/size][/b] [b][i][size=10pt]Specifications[/size][/i][/b] [size=10pt]File Size: [i]6.19mb[/i] Total Files: [i]322[/i] Total Folders: [i]27[/i] Includes: [i]Website-sided files, and server-sided files.[/i] Instructions: [i]Yes[/i] [/size] [b][i][size=10pt]Download Links[/size][/i][/b] Virus Scan: [url=https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/2723536d7de454faa7991dd7fb17cda79932bff06b08642d06146e1679d697ea/analysis/1402249968/][i]VirusTotal[/i][/url] Uppit: [url=http://up.ht/SFE2Tp][i]Download Link[/i][/url] | [url=http://stor2457.uppcdn.com/dl/knomuovyygui563meqgy56p4wifs6m7ihsm3efozyjncyxvea6kg5asn/Runescape3%20Highscores.rar][i]Direct Link[/i][/url] Dropbox: [url=https://www.dropbox.com/s/v0vnwi6tnej9hbe/Runescape3%20Highscores.rar][i]Download Link[/i][/url] | [url=https://www.dropbox.com/meta_dl/eyJzdWJfcGF0aCI6ICIiLCAidGVzdF9saW5rIjogZmFsc2UsICJzZXJ2ZXIiOiAiZGwuZHJvcGJveHVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsICJpdGVtX2lkIjogbnVsbCwgImlzX2RpciI6IGZhbHNlLCAidGtleSI6ICJ2MHZud2k2dG5lajloYmUifQ/AAOLTtWmgoZEDisI3xuspLvsUMwBhO5Q1-DRCPydWXJN7w?dl=1][i]Direct Link[/i][/url] Mediafire: [url=https://www.mediafire.com/?9kcaankjueme86m][i]Download Link[/i][/url] | [url=http://download1334.mediafire.com/j6hk5ux6p9tg/9kcaankjueme86m/Runescape3+Highscores.rar][i]Direct Link[/i][/url]
[size=18pt][b]III. Tutorials and Instructions[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]a. What files are what?[b][/size] Inside the downloaded .rar file, you'll find the following folders: [size=10pt][i]Website-Sided[/i] - The files needed for the website installation. [i]Server-Sided[/i] - The files needed for the server installation.
You will also find the following files in the main directory: [i]rs3_hiscores.sql[/i] - This is what you import into your SQL database. [i]instructions.txt[/i] - These are just some base instructions.
Here is a file by file description. [b][i]/Website-Sided/[/i][/b] [i]compare.php[/i] - A landing page/pre-page of comparing.php [i]comparing.php[/i] - When you are comparing two players, or a single player. [i]index.php[/i] - This is just a splash/home page for the hiscores. [i]ranking.php[/i] - This shows the overall rankings for your server. [i]skill.php[/i] - This is the file for viewing specific skills.
[b][i]/Website-Sided/inc/[/i][/b] [i]class.Compare.php[/i] - These are all of the scripts needed for comparing two users. [i]settings.php[/i] - Here you can find many different settings that are available for change.
[b][i]/Server-Sided/[/i][/b] [i]SQL.java[/i] - This is the main class the is put in the server directory for creating a connection to the hiscores.
[b][i]/Server-Sided/com/ [/i][/b]- This directory includes the JDBC MySQL driver.[/size]
[b][size=14pt]b. Installing Website-Sided[/size][/b] Step 1: Drag everything from [i]/Website-Sided/[/i] to a directory on your webhost (usually [i]/hiscores/[/i]) if you need to make a directory, do so. Step 2: Go into the[i] /inc/ [/i]folder and open [i]settings.php[/i] Step 3: Set the links for your site appropriately. (Login link should be something like [i]http://server.com/forums/login.php[/i]) Step 4: Change your [i]server name[/i] on [i]line 15[/i]. Step 5: Change The Database Information starting on [i]line 18[/i]. Step 6: Type in the names of your staff members, or people you don't want to include in the hiscores on[i] line 28[/i]. Step 7: Create a database or use your existing database. [b]Import[/b] [i]rs3_hiscores.sql[/i] into your database. This will create two new tables.
[b][size=14pt]c. Installing Server-Sided[/size][/b] [i][b]317 Instructions[/b][/i] [b]Step 1:[/b] Drag everything from [i]/Server-Sided/[/i] to your server files. [b]Step 2:[/b] Open up [i]SQL.java[/i] and look for: [code]con = DriverManager.getConnection[/code] in that line, fill in your information (DATABASE_HOST, DATABASE_NAME, USERNAME, and PASSWORD) this is on [i]line 14[/i]. [b]Step 3:[/b] Now we need to start a SQL connection when the server is loaded.. Open up [i]server.java[/i] and look for: [code]public void run() [/code] After that add: [code]SQL.createConnection();[/code] [b]Step 4:[/b] Save and close [i]server.java[/i] and open [i]client.java[/i] Step 5: In[i] client.java[/i] find your [i]logout()[/i] method by searching for [i]logout()[/i] Step 6: Inside your logout method add: [code] SQL.saveHighScores(this);[/code] Step 7: [i][b]Compile [/b][/i]and you're finished!
[size=18pt][b]IV. Images[/b][/size] [img]http://i.imgur.com/eUyNsgv.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Ln3vA5b.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/kFTZ83U.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/VSRGQKw.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/Bnooz4Q.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/MNvWONJ.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/RwS8fRU.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/qSlxbgT.png[/img]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/erC61ck.png[/img]
[size=18pt][b]V. Tested Server Revisions, and Bugs.[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]Tested Revision[/b][/size] 317 Delta/PI - [b]Works[/b]
[size=14pt][b]Reported Bugs[/b][/size] None reported
[size=18pt][b]VI. Credits[/b][/size] Not doing percentages, just people/companies that contributed. Jagex/Runescape 3 - The site design and images. DeathsChaos9 - Inspiration and the SQL.java file found [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=364364.0]here[/url]. The Web Guy - Removing unneeded features, cleaning unneeded CSS/Images, PHP scripts, some Javascript scripts, MySQL, this post, and bringing it all together.

item.title: [Hiscores] Creating New Runescape Hiscores 2014 [RS3]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:5, topic:543784”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662661.msg4429135#msg4429135 date=1402361478]
Anyways. Nice work on this, I’ll download this and maybe use it, but if not it’ll sit in my RSPS storage, like the rest of the stuff I download.

Edit: have you tested multiple page support?
[/quote]

Huh, didn’t know that. Thanks man. I feel like you literally have 50-60GB of random RSPS stuff, haha.[/quote]
I’d have thought so too, but apparently it only totals to ~4 gigs or so. A lot of it is zipped or rar’d.
I’ve got a few 718 servers, a lot of 317 a couple 474’s and some others.
Lots and lots of models.
Tools, sprites, etc. Just junk, literally.
I’ve even got runescapes fonts saved in the drive (The ones they used for the site). I forget why.
I have a 1TB drive and it’s no where near full, so I don’t mind storing extra rsps junk on it lol.
I honestly thought I had more than what I currently do…

Edit: always willing to take more “genuine” rsps stuff to archive on my drive. PM me (anyone) if you think it’s worthy XD

Read full topic

item.title: [Hiscores] Creating New Runescape Hiscores 2014 [RS3]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:543784”]Pro tip for dropbox links:
Replace: https://www.dropbox.com
With:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com
And you get a instant link that isn’t a mile and a half long.
Example:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/v0vnwi6tnej9hbe/Runescape3%20Highscores.rar
To:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/v0vnwi6tnej9hbe/Runescape3%20Highscores.rar

Anyways. Nice work on this, I’ll download this and maybe use it, but if not it’ll sit in my RSPS storage, like the rest of the stuff I download.

Edit: have you tested multiple page support?[/quote]

Huh, didn’t know that. Thanks man. I feel like you literally have 50-60GB of random RSPS stuff, haha.

Read full topic

Edit: have you tested multiple page support?

item.title: [Hiscores] Creating New Runescape Hiscores 2014 [RS3]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“OhExcuseMe, post:2, topic:543784”]Very Nice

However, I get an error when trying to log out and save the game.
“Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.CommunicationsException: Communications link failure”.[/quote]

You might have the database information incorrect. Show me the line that you have, but make sure you block out the password (so that no one can hack you).

Read full topic

item.title: [Hiscores] Creating New Runescape Hiscores 2014 [RS3]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

I think Moparscape has been needing this for a while, updated and current Runescape 3 Highscores. This is for newer revisions, but works for older revisions (317). It would be useful if someone could create tutorials for revisions other than 317, I’m a web guy, not a java guy.

[center][size=18pt]Table of Contents[/size]
[size=14pt]I. Features
II. Download Packages
III. Tutorials and Instructions
IV. Images
V. Tested Server Revisions, and Bugs.
VI. Credits[/size][/center]

[size=18pt]I. Features[/size]
Here is a list of all the current features, and features that are coming soon.

[ul][li]Overall rankings[/li]
[li]Skill-specific rankings[/li]
[li]Player comparison[/li]
[li]Player search[/li]
[li]15 results per page[/li]
[li]Donator icons[/li]
[li]Don’t display staff[/li]
[li]Simple configuration file[/li]
[li]‘Go to’ page box[/li]
[li]Player avatars[/li]
[li]Clan rankings[/li]
[li]Activity rankings[/li]
[li]Site/Forum integration[/li][/ul]

[size=18pt]II. Download Packages[/size]

[size=14pt]Complete Package[/size] [size=12pt]b[/size][/b]
[size=10pt]Specifications[/size]
[size=10pt]File Size: 6.19mb
Total Files: 322
Total Folders: 27
Includes: Website-sided files, and server-sided files.
Instructions: Yes
[/size]
[size=10pt]Download Links[/size]
Virus Scan: VirusTotal
Uppit: Download Link | Direct Link
Dropbox: Download Link | Direct Link
Mediafire: Download Link | Direct Link

[size=18pt]III. Tutorials and Instructions[/size]
[size=14pt][b]a. What files are what?[b][/size]
Inside the downloaded .rar file, you’ll find the following folders:
[size=10pt]Website-Sided - The files needed for the website installation.
Server-Sided - The files needed for the server installation.

You will also find the following files in the main directory:
rs3_hiscores.sql - This is what you import into your SQL database.
instructions.txt - These are just some base instructions.

Here is a file by file description.
/Website-Sided/
compare.php - A landing page/pre-page of comparing.php
comparing.php - When you are comparing two players, or a single player.
index.php - This is just a splash/home page for the hiscores.
ranking.php - This shows the overall rankings for your server.
skill.php - This is the file for viewing specific skills.

/Website-Sided/inc/
class.Compare.php - These are all of the scripts needed for comparing two users.
settings.php - Here you can find many different settings that are available for change.

/Server-Sided/
SQL.java - This is the main class the is put in the server directory for creating a connection to the hiscores.

/Server-Sided/com/ - This directory includes the JDBC MySQL driver.[/size]

[size=14pt]b. Installing Website-Sided[/size]
Step 1: Drag everything from /Website-Sided/ to a directory on your webhost (usually /hiscores/) if you need to make a directory, do so.
Step 2: Go into the /inc/ folder and open settings.php
Step 3: Set the links for your site appropriately. (Login link should be something like http://server.com/forums/login.php)
Step 4: Change your server name on line 15.
Step 5: Change The Database Information starting on line 18.
Step 6: Type in the names of your staff members, or people you don’t want to include in the hiscores on line 28.
Step 7: Create a database or use your existing database. Import rs3_hiscores.sql into your database. This will create two new tables.

[size=14pt]c. Installing Server-Sided[/size]
317 Instructions
Step 1: Drag everything from /Server-Sided/ to your server files.
Step 2: Open up SQL.java and look for:

in that line, fill in your information (DATABASE_HOST, DATABASE_NAME, USERNAME, and PASSWORD) this is on line 14.
Step 3: Now we need to start a SQL connection when the server is loaded… Open up server.java and look for:

After that add:

Step 4: Save and close server.java and open client.java
Step 5: In client.java find your logout() method by searching for logout()
Step 6: Inside your logout method add:

Step 7: Compile and you’re finished!

[size=18pt]IV. Images[/size]

[size=18pt]V. Tested Server Revisions, and Bugs.[/size]
[size=14pt]Tested Revision[/size]
317 Delta/PI - Works

[size=14pt]Reported Bugs[/size]
None reported

[size=18pt]VI. Credits[/size]
Not doing percentages, just people/companies that contributed.
Jagex/Runescape 3 - The site design and images.
DeathsChaos9 - Inspiration and the SQL.java file found here.
The Web Guy - Removing unneeded features, cleaning unneeded CSS/Images, PHP scripts, some Javascript scripts, MySQL, this post, and bringing it all together.

Read full topic
